name: Sweet Potato Roti Tacos
description:
For Full Recipe ~ Use QR Code

Recipe by: Dr. Akala Lemus, D.C.
10/2/2018 - Moon in Cancer - Sun in Libra


Sweet Potato Roti Ingredients (makes 4):
1 cup (~2-3) sweet potato, steamed
¼ cup (~3 stalks) green onion, diced
2 Tbsp plant based butter
1 Tbsp garlic (~2 cloves), minced
1 cup all purpose flour 
fresh ground salt (1/2 tsp) & pepper (1/8 tsp) to taste 

Taco Filling Ingredients:
1 cup rice, cooked
1 cup celery, diced
1 can black beans, w/water
1 cup zucchini, chopped into small pieces
1 cup (~5-6) mushrooms, sliced
1 carrot, shredded 
5 - 6 cherry tomatoes, halved
½ avocado, thinly sliced 
1 tsp cumin 
1 tsp oregano
½ tsp smoked paprika 
2 Tbsp (~½) lemon juice
Fresh ground salt (1/4 tsp) & pepper to taste

Taco Filling Method:

1. Boil 1 cup of rice in 2 cups of water. Place a veggie steamer basket or colander in the same pot you are cooking rice in, and add the roughly chopped sweet potatoes to it. Cover with a lid so the sweet potato steams while the rice is cooking. (***if you have already steamed you sweet potato, skip to step 6 where it says “Sweet Potato Roti Method”)

2. Prep all the veggies, and set aside.

3. Add 2 Tbsp minced garlic, 1 /4 cup finely diced green onion, & 2 Tbsp plant based butter to a pan. Bring to a low simmer for ~ 3-5 min or until green onions are slightly browned.

4. Add 1 can black beans to a sauce pot, then add the following ingredients, cover w/a lid & bring to a simmer over a low heat.  

1 tsp cumin 
1 tsp oregano
½ tsp smoked paprika 
2 Tbsp (~½) lemon juice
Fresh ground salt (1/4 tsp) & pepper to taste

5. Remove the green onion from the pan & put it into a heat safe mixing bowl.


Sweet Potato Roti Method:

6. Add the sweet potatoes to the green onions (see step 3 above); as long as you can put a fork into a sweet potato piece & pull it back out with little to no effort. If the sweet potato is still not tender, continue to steam. (***Make sure to turn the heat off the rice once the water has completely evaporated or when rice is tender. Keep covered to retain the heat.)

7. Using a fork, smash the sweet potato & incorporate the green onion mixture while doing so. 

8. Once the sweet potatoes are well smashed, add ~ ¼ tsp fresh ground salt & pepper to taste + ¼ cup all purpose flour at a time until the dough is firm enough to handle. It will still be a bit sticky, but make sure to keep your hands & working surface well floured rather than adding a ton of flour to make it easier to work w/or you will end up w/pizza crust instead of soft roti tacos because this dough gets tougher the more it is handled & the more flour it contains. Also be mindful not to overwork the dough. 

9. Once the dough can be formed, roll the dough into a cylinder shape by rubbing it between your two hands like you’re making a snake out of playdough ;) and then separate the dough into 4 pieces. 

10. Work the dough into a tortilla shape and transfer to a hot pan (no oil is required).

11. Heat on both sides for 2 min intervals until you have cooked each piece for about 5-7 min or until they bubble up like pillows or become golden brown. Transfer to a dish lined in towels so you can keep them warm until you are ready to use them. 

12. TIME TO PUT IT ALL TOGETHER! inJOY!



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
